title: Status Epilepticus
scope: ** Management of convulsive status epilepticus (CSE) and non-convulsive status epilepticus (NCSE) in adults. Covers staged treatment protocol from emergent benzodiazepines through refractory and super-refractory phases. Includes diagnostic workup to identify underlying etiology and specific protocols for NORSE/FIRES. Excludes pediatric status epilepticus, neonatal seizures, and psychogenic non-epileptic status.

Essential/Core Labs.rationale: Electrolyte abnormalities, renal/hepatic function for ASM dosing
Elevated in prolonged seizure; marker of severity

Extended Workup (Second-line).rationale: Hepatic encephalopathy, valproate toxicity, urea cycle disorders

Rare/Specialized (Refractory or Atypical.rationale: Subacute onset, smoking history, weight loss

Essential/First-line.timing: As soon as available; mandatory in RSE/SRSE
Essential/First-line.target: Seizure burden, treatment response, NCSE detection

Extended.item: MRI brain with and without contrast (CPT 70553)
Extended.target: Encephalitis, stroke, tumor, cortical injury from SE

Extended.item: CT angiography head/neck (CTA head CPT 70496, CTA neck CPT 70498)

dosing.instructions: Head-tilt chin-lift, oral airway, prepare for intubation
Non-rebreather 15 L/min or bag-valve-mask
18G or larger x2
Continuous telemetry
50 mL IV push (25g) if glucose <70 or unknown
100-500 mg IV BEFORE or WITH glucose
NS or LR wide open initially
0.1 mg/kg IV (max 4 mg/dose); may repeat x1 in 5 min if still seizing; total max 8 mg

Emergent/First-Line - Benzodiazepines (T.monitoring: RR, O2 sat, BP, sedation; airway equipment ready

dosing.instructions: 10 mg IM (≥40 kg) or 0.2 mg/kg IM (if no IV access); single dose

Emergent/First-Line - Benzodiazepines (T.monitoring: RR, O2 sat; prepare IV access

dosing.instructions: 0.2 mg/kg IV (max 10 mg); may repeat x1
5 mg per nostril (10 mg total) if no IV/IM access
10 mg buccal (if available)
0.15 mg/kg IV (max 10 mg); may repeat x1 in 5 min

Emergent/First-Line - Benzodiazepines (T.monitoring: RR, O2 sat; short duration - requires follow-up ASM

dosing.instructions: 0.2-0.5 mg/kg PR (max 20 mg); use rectal gel formulation
60 mg/kg IV (max 4500 mg) over 10-15 min
40 mg/kg IV (max 4500 mg) over 10-15 min
20 mg PE/kg IV at 150 mg PE/min; may give additional 5-10 mg PE/kg if needed

Urgent/Second-Line ASMs (Time 5-20 min).contraindications: 2nd/3rd degree AV block, sinus bradycardia, allergy
Urgent/Second-Line ASMs (Time 5-20 min).monitoring: Continuous cardiac monitor, BP q5min during infusion

dosing.instructions: 40 mg/kg IV (max 3000 mg) over 10 min

Urgent/Second-Line ASMs (Time 5-20 min).contraindications: Pregnancy, hepatic disease, mitochondrial disease, urea cycle disorders, pancreatitis
Urgent/Second-Line ASMs (Time 5-20 min).monitoring: Ammonia, LFTs; avoid in unknown pregnancy status

dosing.instructions: 400 mg IV over 15 min (can give 200 mg over 5 min if urgent)

Urgent/Second-Line ASMs (Time 5-20 min).contraindications: PR >200 ms, 2nd/3rd degree AV block, severe hepatic impairment

dosing.instructions: 100-200 mg IV over 2-5 min; no titration needed

Urgent/Second-Line ASMs (Time 5-20 min).monitoring: Faster onset than levetiracetam; fewer behavioral effects

dosing.instructions: 20 mg/kg IV at max 50 mg/min (if fosphenytoin unavailable)

Urgent/Second-Line ASMs (Time 5-20 min).monitoring: Cardiac monitor; MUST use large vein, tissue necrosis risk

dosing.instructions: 15-20 mg/kg IV at 50-100 mg/min

Urgent/Second-Line ASMs (Time 5-20 min).monitoring: Respiratory depression; often requires intubation at this dose

dosing.instructions: Load: 0.2 mg/kg IV bolus; Infusion: start 0.1 mg/kg/hr, titrate by 0.1 mg/kg/hr q15min to seizure suppression; max 2 mg/kg/hr; target burst suppression on cEEG
Load: 1-2 mg/kg IV bolus (may repeat x1); Infusion: start 20 mcg/kg/min, titrate by 10 mcg/kg/min q5min; max 200 mcg/kg/min; target burst suppression

Refractory SE - Anesthetic Infusions (Ti.contraindications: Propofol infusion syndrome risk (limit to <48h at high dose), egg/soy allergy, pregnancy
Refractory SE - Anesthetic Infusions (Ti.monitoring: cEEG, triglycerides q24-48h, CPK, metabolic acidosis, BP

dosing.instructions: Load: 1-2 mg/kg IV bolus; Infusion: start 1 mg/kg/hr, titrate by 0.5 mg/kg/hr q15-30min; max 5 mg/kg/hr

Refractory SE - Anesthetic Infusions (Ti.contraindications: Uncontrolled hypertension, elevated ICP (relative - actually may be neuroprotective)
Refractory SE - Anesthetic Infusions (Ti.monitoring: cEEG, BP (may increase), HR; less hypotension than other anesthetics

dosing.instructions: Ketamine load 1 mg/kg + Midazolam load 0.2 mg/kg; then dual infusions per above

Refractory SE - Anesthetic Infusions (Ti.monitoring: 2024 data: combination may reduce SE duration faster than midazolam alone

dosing.instructions: Load: 5-15 mg/kg IV at 50 mg/min; Infusion: start 0.5-1 mg/kg/hr, titrate to burst suppression; max 5 mg/kg/hr

Refractory SE - Anesthetic Infusions (Ti.monitoring: cEEG, BP (significant hypotension - need pressors), cardiac output; longest half-life

dosing.instructions: Combine midazolam + propofol, or add ketamine to either
Load 300-400 mg via NGT; then 200-400 mg BID; max 1600 mg/day
400 mg IV, then 200-400 mg BID
4-8 mg via NGT daily; titrate to 12 mg daily

doseOptions.orderSentence: Magnesium Sulfate 4 g IV loading dose

dosing.instructions: 4-6 g IV over 20 min, then 1-2 g/hr infusion; target Mg 3.5-4 mg/dL
100-500 mg IV; may try single dose empirically
Initiate within 7 days per NORSE consensus; requires nutrition support

Super-Refractory SE - Additional Agents.contraindications: Pyruvate carboxylase deficiency, fatty acid oxidation disorders

dosing.instructions: Targeted temperature management x 24-48h
If all else fails; requires anesthesia
Resection if focal lesion identified

doseOptions.orderSentence: Methylprednisolone Iv 1000 mg IV daily x3-5 days

dosing.instructions: 1000 mg IV daily × 3-5 days

NORSE/FIRES Immunotherapy Protocol.monitoring: Glucose q6h, BP, GI prophylaxis, infection signs

doseOptions.orderSentence: Ivig 0.4 g/kg IV daily x5 days
Ivig 1 g/kg IV daily x2 days
Ivig 2 g/kg IV divided over 2-5 days

dosing.instructions: 0.4 g/kg/day IV × 5 days (total 2 g/kg); can give simultaneously with steroids
dosing.orderSentence: Ivig 0.4 g/kg IV daily x5 days

NORSE/FIRES Immunotherapy Protocol.contraindications: IgA deficiency (use IgA-depleted product), renal failure, thrombosis risk
NORSE/FIRES Immunotherapy Protocol.monitoring: Renal function, signs of aseptic meningitis, thrombosis

dosing.instructions: 5-7 exchanges over 10-14 days; 1-1.5 plasma volumes per exchange
375 mg/m² IV weekly × 4 doses
750-1000 mg/m² IV monthly × 3-6 months

NORSE/FIRES Immunotherapy Protocol.monitoring: CBC weekly, renal function, hemorrhagic cystitis (hydration + mesna)

dosing.instructions: 8 mg/kg IV q4 weeks (emerging option)
100 mg SC daily (may increase; used in FIRES)
Start 0.1 mcg/kg/min; titrate to MAP ≥65
0.04 units/min fixed dose
25-100 mcg/hr; titrate to comfort
5-50 mcg/kg/min
0.2-1.5 mcg/kg/hr
40 mg IV daily
40 mg SC daily (start when stable)
Per ICU protocol; target glucose 140-180 mg/dL

Referrals & Consults.indication: All SE requiring second-line agents or ongoing seizures
Mandatory for RSE/SRSE; strongly recommended for all SE
Enteral feeding, ketogenic diet initiation (by Day 7 in NORSE)
SRSE with poor prognosis, goals of care discussion
Focal lesion on imaging, refractory to medical therapy

Patient/Family Instructions.item: Explain SE is a medical emergency requiring ICU care
Discuss prognosis based on etiology and duration of SE
Educate on importance of ASM adherence (if applicable)
Seizure first aid education for family
Rescue medication training (rectal diazepam, nasal midazolam)
Driving restrictions (minimum 3-6 months seizure-free, varies by state)
Discuss goals of care if SRSE with poor prognosis

Lifestyle & Prevention.item: Avoid abrupt ASM discontinuation (common SE precipitant)
Pregnancy planning counseling (women of childbearing potential)

differential.features: Preserved awareness, asynchronous movements, eye closure, pelvic thrusting, prolonged duration with minimal post-ictal period
differential.tests: Video EEG, normal cEEG during event

differential.features: Brief (< 30 sec), occurs with LOC, myoclonic jerks possible
differential.tests: History of prodrome, rapid recovery, normal EEG

differential.features: Associated with fever/chills, rhythmic shaking, preserves awareness
Associated with structural brain injury, sustained posturing

evidence.recommendation: IM midazolam non-inferior to IV lorazepam
Second-line agents (LEV, VPA, fPHT) equivalent efficacy
Ketogenic diet by Day 7 in NORSE
Second-line immunotherapy by Day 7 if first-line fails

disposition.criteria: All SE requiring second-line ASMs; all RSE/SRSE; altered mental status; need for airway management; hemodynamic instability
Seizures controlled x 24h, off anesthetics x 24h, stable neuro exam, no airway concerns
Seizures controlled, off continuous monitoring, stable on oral ASMs, resolved AMS
Seizures controlled, stable on oral ASM regimen, etiology identified and addressed, family educated, follow-up arranged
Need for services unavailable (cEEG, neurocritical care, epilepsy surgery evaluation)
Persistent deficits after prolonged SE, need for ongoing rehabilitation
SRSE with irreversible brain injury, goals of care established
